publisher.publisher-name: Military Operations Research Society in cooperation with the Military Applications Society (MAS) of the Institute for Operations Research and Management Science (INFORMS)

permissions.copyright-statement: © 2005, Military Operations Research Society and Military Application Society

fn.p: JFCOM J9 has used JWARS for Unified Quest 05, has combined JWARS with the human-in-the-loop Joint Semi-Automated Forces model, is using JWARS in its current Sea-Basing Limited Objective Experiment, and plans to use JWARS in support of Unified Engagement 06, a Title X war game. SSCC is also planning to use JWARS to support Trident Warrior 05, a war game examining FORCEnet principles.

For more information on the Operational Availability studies, see Wilmer Sweetser, “Assessing Military Capabilities against Strategic Goals: An Overview of Operational Availability Assessments,” PHALANX, Vol 38, No 1 (March 2005), pp. 6-8.

Results from the JWARS MCO AB comparison study will be available to the analytic community in November 2005. For more information on this study, and for contact information, go to the JWARS websites at https://jwars.pae.osd.smil.mil or http://www.jwarsonline.com.

Other recent studies citing JWARS include Melim, P. and S. Darcy, “Assessing the Effects of Joint Fires on Joint Forcible Entry Operations (JFEO)” (June 2005; briefed at 73rd MORS Symposium, received MORS Impact Coin) and Murphy, T., “Evaluation of Close Air Support (CAS) Simulation in Service Models” (AFIT Graduate Research Project, June 2005).
